property.name: description
property.value: Link to TravisCI service (www.travis-ci.org). TravisCI is a continuous integration framework, which automatically tests the build of a given Github project. Although this is not included in the Github API, it can be extracted from the list of files present in the repository

property.name: label
property.value: Link to Travis CI

property.name: description
property.value: true if the developer(s) has specified a license according to the Github license specification rules

property.name: label
property.value: Presence of a license

property.name: description
property.value: Repository Starring is a feature that lets users bookmark repositories. Stars are shown next to repositories to show an approximate level of interest. Stars have no effect on notifications or the activity feed

property.name: label
property.value: Number of stargazers

property.name: label
property.value: Number of contributors (persons that did at least one commit)

property.name: label
property.value: Number of subscribers (Watchers in the Github UI): Watching a Repository registers the user to receive notifications on new discussions, as well as events in the users activity feed

property.name: description
property.value: true is a wiki has been set up in the repository.

property.name: label
property.value: Presence of a wiki

property.name: description
property.value: Number of git forks (i.e. repository clones on github)

property.name: label
property.value: Number of forks

property.name: description
property.value: This indicator represents the age of the repository, in years

property.name: label
property.value: Age of repository in years

property.name: label
property.value: Number of pull requests (last year)

property.name: label
property.value: Percent of contributors that did >90% of all commits (last year)

property.name: label
property.value: Percent of contributors that did >50% of all commits (last year)

property.name: label
property.value: Days elapsed from opening to closing an issue, in average (last year)

property.name: label
property.value: Ratio of issues still open (from issues opened last year)

property.name: label
property.value: Average number of comments per issue (last year)

property.name: label
property.value: Sum of all contributions (i.e. commits) to the project

property.name: description
property.value: Refers to the possibility that critical bugs are present and/or not promptly patched.

property.name: description
property.value: Refers to a lack of popularity of the project, due to a reduced number of people following it and reporting bugs and opening issues

property.name: description
property.value: Refers to the (lack of) quality of the software to be easily understood from the adopter

property.name: description
property.value: Refers to the activeness of the project developers (contributors), their responsiveness in the issue tracker and the stability of the project (including project age)

property.name: argument
property.value: The repository seems to be unmaintained

property.name: argument
property.value: There is no link to a Continuous Integration framework

property.name: argument
property.value: The license has not been specified

property.name: argument
property.value: The repository is not followed by many people

property.name: argument
property.value: There is no documentation available

property.name: argument
property.value: The ratio between open and closed issues is high

property.name: argument
property.value: The repository is relatively young

property.name: argument
property.value: No link to a Continuous Integration found

property.name: argument
property.value: No license found

property.name: argument
property.value: No wiki found

property.name: argument
property.value: Low forks count

property.name: argument
property.value: Long time passed from the last activity

property.name: argument
property.value: The number of stargazers is high

property.name: argument
property.value: The number of stargazers is high

property.name: argument
property.value: The number of contributors is high

property.name: argument
property.value: There are many pull requests

property.name: argument
property.value: A relatively low number of developers made more than 90 parcent of commits

property.name: argument
property.value: A relatively high number of developers made mode than 80 parcent of commits

property.name: argument
property.value: On average, the number of days required to close issues is relatively high

property.name: argument
property.value: There is a relatively high number of open issues

property.name: argument
property.value: Project is fragile
